intro: Adicea sarcophylla, commonly known as the rock fig, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces edible fig-like fruits that are typically consumed by birds and small mammals. Adicea sarcophylla thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its ability to survive in harsh conditions makes it an important component of local ecosystems.
